page.title: 10Recreation-Newmarket (2)
page.content:
Horse racing: The "rubbing shed" still standing near the course where horses were rubbed down before being walked home is featured in old paintings. The courses are kept in excellent condition and the water is supplied from the Jockey Club bore hole. During the second world war the course was used by the R.A.F. and the Rowley Mile became the longest runway in Bomber Command. Light planes and helicopters connected with the racing industry now use the Heath.
Swimming: The town's swimming pool is in this area and, although it is not very large, now that it is heated is very well patronised all the year round.
